go_data.justification: PNGase cleaves the amide bond between the proximal N-acetylglucosamine and the linker asparagine residues on glycopeptides/glycoproteins.
PNG1 may be required for efficient proteasome-mediated degradation of a misfolded glycoprotein.
Subcellular localization studies indicate that the Png1p is found in the nucleus, with a lower level occurring in the cytoplasm.
Subcellular localization studies indicate that the Png1p is found in the cytosol.
